events.name: Building your own self-driving car and creating conversational agents
events.description:
Opening talk:
Building my first conversational agent.

API.AI is a Google-owned service that helps developers build conversational experiences for different platforms. It simplifies designing your own natural language bot. I’ll share my experience on using API. AI to create a conversational agent who helped users decide what meals they wanted to prepare, and guide them through the recipe.

Main talk:
Getting acquainted with neural networks by building a 1/12 scale self driving car.

The self-driving car project is an educational hardware kit meant to be a hands on way to learn about neural networks and how self driving cars work. We’ll cover how to set up the hardware and how images are processed by the ‘car’ with a 9-layer convolution network (tensorflow + keras).

Daniel Goncharov is the co-founder of ZeGoBeast Robotics, an EdTech company. He got his degree in Applied Math & Software Engineering in Russia, and loves to develop with hardware. He’s spent the last 6 months developing the self-driving car kit project with a few 42 students.

events.name: BayFest DevFest 2017 - Hackathon
events.description:
DevFest is a large, community ­run event that offers speaker sessions across multiple areas, code labs and more. It is an annual event that is targeted to developers and technologist and powered by a shared belief that when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen. DevFest 2017 will have a code lab, speaker sessions and a hack-a-thon event over the course of three weekends.


Technical Talks | San Francisco | October 28, 9:30am - 4:30pm

This all day event will feature back to back speaker sessions on a variety of topics (Machine Learning, Android, IOT, Cloud & more!), and a codelab where participants can get some guided instruction on how to get started with Firebase.

Hack-a-thon | Fremont | November 4,10am - 10pm, & 5, 10am - 5pm, 2017

This event will be the perfect opportunity to put to work all of the new knowledge you've gained and work with others to a hack a project!

More information: https://bayfest2017.com/

Tickets: http://bit.ly/DevFest17

events.name: Data: How is it collected and how does Google use it for Google Products (Maps)
events.description:
Main Talk:

How does Google use data from NASA instruments to create its products?

How Google uses data from NASA instruments like MODIS, VIIRS and Landsat to create its products.  Google has at least one guy that I know who is actively working with Landsat data and I know that data from other instruments built by Raytheon gets used, too.  Raytheon is not really involved in that process, because the government collects the data and gives it away for free, but I can certainly talk about the data, how it is collected and how it gets used at Google, based on publicly disclosed information.

This is Dr. Jeffrey Puschell, chief scientist at Raytheon Space & Airborne Systems. He has done engineering work on instruments in EOS MODIS and Landsat-7, data from which is used in Google Maps and Google Earth. If you want to know more about Dr. Jeffrey Puschell, you can check out his (inter)stellar bio, or his LinkedIn.
events.how_to_find_us: Please enter the building through the back entrance, and then proceed straight to presentation room. If you come in through the front, just go around the building until you are on the opposite side. If you see someone, please ask for directions.

events.name: Text Translator: finally communicating with my in-laws
events.description:
A great way to learn how to use something is by building a passion project. We'll talk through how to build web app that translate text message. We'll be using Flask for our backend, Twilio to send and receive text messages, Google Translate API to translate message and Google App Engine to deploy the web app.

About our speaker:
Jessica Dene Earley-Cha is from Calexico, CA and received her bachelor’s in Sociology, Education: Applied Psychology from UCSB. She spent almost a decade working with at-risk youth with mental health challenges in disadvantaged areas. Jessica decided to follow her passion of coding and graduated from a software Boot Camp. She is full stack developer who enjoys sharing knowledge and support others. Jessica is the co-organizer for Google Developers Group San Francisco, is a Women Techmakers lead, teacher for Girl Develop It, active with Latin@s in Tech and co-creator of DevelopHerDevelopHim. You’ll find her either listening to other’s life stories or coding one of her many personal projects. She recently started a new role, Developer Advocate with Google.
events.how_to_find_us: Please go around the building to the back entrance.

events.name: ReactJS for non ReactJS developers
events.description:
Have you ever wondered if React JS is suitable for your application? Do you already have a Javascript website and are thinking about refactoring? Are you unsure about the benefits or the learning curve of React JS?In this talk I am going to describe the characteristics, benefits and best practices of React JS, the tools and frameworks to build a website and my experience transitioning from a pure Javascript application to a React JS website

About our speaker:
Linda has a sincere passion for resolving complex problems and business challenges through technical innovation and human collaboration. She has developed software in e-commerce, human resources, messaging and healthcare spaces, at companies like Sears, Electronic Arts, Netflix, and startups like Curai. Linda graduated from Carnegie Mellon University with a Master of Science degree in Software Engineering and loves to share her experiences as an engineer and as a Latina woman in tech.

And our co-speaker:
Vignesh (or Viggy, if you prefer) is a recent graduate of Stanford University and is currently working as an engineer at Curai, a healthcare startup with ambitions of changing the world. He previously interned at various smaller startups and industry giants like eBay and Palantir. Outside of work, Viggy enjoys hacking on various side projects and performing South Indian classical music
events.how_to_find_us: Please go around the building to the back entrance

events.name: Developer Relations, the modern day bard
events.description:
As someone in developer relation, I spin tales of achievements you can do on my platform. Of how you can be a hero or even a legend. I guide your quest by telling you what other adventurers did to achieve what they did. I weave into my tale on how by visiting certain places you find tools you need and if those tools are lacking I sing to the gods for more support.

About James Cha:
James Cha is Head of Developer Relations at Clover. There he leads a team that introduces, educates, and empowers third party developers on the Clover Platform. He has been working with developer community as an GDG organizer for 8 years and empowering other organizers as a mentor for 4 years for the Pacific region. On his off time, he is playing board games and hanging out with his dog, River.
events.how_to_find_us: Please go around the building through the back entrance. The meetup will be hosted in the room just down the hall.

events.name: Next '18 Extended Fremont
events.description:
Google Cloud Next Extended brings together developer communities around the world to take part in the Next ‘18 experience!

Live Stream of Google Cloud Next + Qwiklabs on Intro to Machine Learning:

Hands-on labs: Free access to Qwiklabs, so everyone can participate in hands-on learning.

Lab: Intro to Machine Learning
Qwiklab:
Cloud ML Engine: Qwik Start (lab) - Train and deploy a TensorFlow model to Cloud ML Engine.

Cloud Natural Language API: Qwik Start (lab) - Perform sentiment analysis on a block of text.

Complete all the labs in your Quest and earn a Google Cloud badge. Finish within a month and earn an additional month of Qwiklabs access.
List your Google Cloud badge on your resume and your LinkedIn profile, and don’t forget to join the social media conversation with #next18extended!

Free Coursera Offer!
1 month free on Google Cloud Specializations on Coursera

events.name: Visualization for Data Studio and Automate G Suite with Apps Script
events.description:
1st Session Title: Create your own visualization for Data Studio

Abstract:
Learn how to create custom JavaScript visualizations that integrate into your Data Studio dashboards. Data Studio community visualizations allow you to create custom visualizations using JavaScript and Google Cloud Storage that you can then share with others in your organization. Familiarity with JavaScript and visualization libraries like d3.js will be helpful for those attending this talk.

Speaker Bio:
Yulan Lin is a Developer Advocate for Google Data Studio. Her experiences span NLP, bioinformatics, and music. She is always willing to chat about messy data, dataviz, and crocheting.

2nd Session Title: Automate G Suite with Apps Script

Abstract:
Learn how to increase the power of your favorite Google apps — like Calendar, Docs, Drive, Gmail, Sheets, and Slides – with Apps Script, a JavaScript platform in Google Cloud.

Speaker Bio:
Grant is a developer platform engineer at Google where he leads open source for G Suite APIs. He loves Node, GitHub, and plays the alto saxophone in his spare time.

events.name: GDG Fremont Holiday Social
events.description:
Let's celebrate this holiday season with awesome friends and acquaintances. GDG Fremont will be hosting its first GDG Holiday Social and we want you to be part of it.

Let's talk about what you guys would like to see for the upcoming year with ideas, requests or feedback you have, or just come for the food. You might be leaving with some cool swag. 0.-

This will be low key and there won't be material prepared. Instead we'll allow everyone to take the floor to talk to us about any cool ideas you'd like the GDG Fremont chapter to get on board with and for you to see.

See you on the 20th at 7:00 pm at 42 Silicon Valley. Be there or be square ^_^.
events.how_to_find_us: You are able to park on the back of the building.  You'll see the 42 logo at the entrance.  Continue straight through the double doors and you'll see the main hall.

events.name: GDG Fremont + 42 Silicon Valley = Google Hash Code Qualification Round
events.description:
We are excited to announce that GDG Fremont at 42 Silicon Valley is an official hub for the Google Hash Code Qualification Round, we are calling everyone to partake in this amazing competition.

Hash Code is a team programming competition, organized by Google, for students and professionals around the world. You pick your team and programming language and Google picks an engineering problem for you to solve. This year’s contest kicks off with an Online Qualification Round, where your team can compete from wherever you’d like, including from one of our Hash Code hubs. Top teams will then be invited to a Google office for the Final Round.

The Online Qualification Round takes place on February 28th, 2019 at 17:30 UTC (9:30 AM PST) and registered teams from USA are invited to participate from our hub, which will take place in Z1 (2nd Floor). Top scoring teams from the Online Qualification Round will then be invited to Google’s offices in Dublin, Ireland to compete in the Final Round of the competition in April.
If you’re interested in joining our hub, find a team (2 to 4 people) and be sure you all register at g.co/hashcode . You’ll then need to select 42 Silicon Valley from the list of hubs in the Judge System.

Registration closes February 25th! sign up before this date.
events.how_to_find_us: You are able to park on the back of the building.  You'll see the 42 logo at the entrance.  Continue straight through the double doors and you'll see the main hall.

events.name: IWD: International Women's Day :-> Celebrating Women in Tech
events.description:
IWD is a large, community-run event that offers speaker sessions on Technology and Professional & Personal Development. It is an event that is targeted at developers and tech enthusiasts who are powered by a shared belief that when we come together to exchange ideas amazing things can happen. The speakers will be women and non-binary people in tech who want to inspire, educate and connect!

International Women's Day is an important moment to recognize how women have influenced the tech industry and beyond.

A day full of inspirational talks, workshops and codelabs.

Speakers and agenda :-

Talks (2:15 P.m- 4:15 P.m) ( 3 talks Half an hour each)
#NoFakeNews Workshop (2.15 P.m-3:45 P.m)
Build Actions for the Google Assistant :- Actions on Google CodeLabs (2:15 P.m - 4:15 P.m)

Cake Cutting/Food/Networking : 3:30p.m -5:00p.m

Speaker's List

Liliana Chiou (Director of Engineering and Solutions at CSU East Bay)

Experienced transformational IT Director, solutions-driven technology leader, technical architect with excellent IT management and communication skills. Vast in research and development, data analysis, team mentoring, and strategic planning. Exceptional leadership capability and Information Technology expertise to plan and lead a series of IT development initiatives, determined to implement earned skills for the rapid growth of the prospective organization.

Gnana Lakshmi T C (Gyan)

She is the Leadership Fellow for Blockchain at Women Who Code. She is responsible for leading and managing the Blockchain community for WWCode across the globe. With over 6+ years of experience as a Software Developer in the corporate industry, Gyan is extremely passionate about women in technology and has been leading the Bangalore network of Women Who Code for 2+ years. She has conducted several meetups and has given several tech talks on varied technology topics like Blockchain and Machine Learning. She is also a very hands-on coder and loves working on emerging technologies.

Patricia Diaz (LX Researcher)

"I like to think of the world not only as it is but as it could be. I've studied the learning process from all possible perspectives: from the molecular events that allow for neural plasticity to the behavioral and organizational aspects of it. With that knowledge, I use emergent technologies to design tools and environments that enhance learning. I thrive at distilling research and strategizing to translate findings into real-world solutions that work at scale."

Gaytri Khandelwal (Technical Sales Lead @Salesforce | Chapter Director @Startup Grind)

She is an engineer by education is passionate about how the new technologies are leading the new revenue opportunities & business models. She is a technical sales leader at Salesforce and helps customers realize their connected customer experience vision by leveraging Cloud/IOT/AI solutions. She runs a Startup Grind chapter for the city of Fremont. She is board member at a non-profit (National Association of Mental Illness) and an angel investor/advisor to early-stage startups. She spent 20 years leading large-scale business transformations and driving customer success at Cisco, General Electric, Unilever and many others. Holds Engineering degree from IIT (Indian Institute of Technology) and executive certifications from top institutions. A firm believer of living a healthy & happy life, giving back to the community, and promoting technology startups.

Nittia Chavez Henry (Talent Development & Growth Intern)
Driven and dedicated to achieving all short and long-term goals. Using my excellent communication skills, I have proven to be a good collaborator who is flexible and adaptable. Currently, I am at Quantcast as a Talent Development and Growth Intern as well as a Project Management trainee for a Year Up, a year-long intensive career and technical training program
events.how_to_find_us: Please enter through Dumbarton Circle and drive towards the back of the building.  Once you enter through the main doors, please follow the signs to get to the speaker rooms. ^_^

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 [GDG Fremont/Cloud Silicon Valley/Cloud Fremont]
events.description:
Haven't gotten the chance to catch up on what went down at Google I/O?

Welcome to I/O Extended 2019 with GDG Fremont/Cloud Silicon Valley/Cloud Fremont!

We're hosting a viewing party of the 2019 Developer keynote from Google I/O so you can get all caught up as well as some live talks and codelabs.

Agenda:
10:00am: Check-in, Network over coffee.
10:20am: Google I/O Extended 2019 kickoff
11:00am: Live Talk with Vikram Tiwari
11:00am: Live Talk with Michael Solati
12:00pm: Lunch break
12:15pm: Continue lunch break. Who’s looking and who’s hiring?
Looking? Bring your best minute pitch for everyone to hear.
1:00pm: Codelab with Riya - bring your laptops!
1:45pm: Event wrap-up before social hour. Feel free to stick around to chat amongst your fellow devs for a bit or get help on your code! Stay for our goodies raffle. You won't wanna miss out.

ML Study Jam Track
11:00 - 11:20 Intro to Qwiklabs
11:20 - 12:00 GCP Essentials
1:00 - 1:20 Intro to Tensorflow
1:20 - 2:00 Baseline: Data, ML, AI

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Speakers:
Michael Solati: Building (Progressive) Web Apps @MichaelSolati

Most people think if they want to build an app they must build two apps for Android or iOS. The web has become so much more powerful in what we can do, though. JavaScript frameworks allow developers to build a powerful web app with a fraction of the time and resources of native apps. While tools like Ionic are allowing developers to make beautiful web apps that look and behave so much like native application with their UI and offline capabilities; so much so that users might not even tell the difference. Even cooler is now you can install apps from the web onto your phone like a native app.

The web is advancing at an unprecedented rate, and you should be taking advantage of this. Learn what makes a progressive web app so progressive and some of the tooling you can use to build amazing (web) apps!

Vikram Tiwari: Cloud Run and AutoML Tables @Vikram_Tiwari

Serverless compute and ML on Google Cloud using Cloud Run and AutoML.

Building scalable web and data platforms for high availability, resilience, and security. Co-founder and all things tech at Omnilabsinc. GDE
at GoogleCloud and MachineLearning.

Riya Dashoriya: @ReeyahSDasoriya
"It's not that we use technology, we live technology" - Godfrey Reggio

I have a great zeal to learn about new technologies and share knowledge with people. I love coding. I like challenges at work or anything which can help me improve myself. I've veritable curiosity and passion to dig into things and find out how they work.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - [HANDS-ON  Machine Learning and networking]
events.description:
Details
Join us for our upcoming Cloud Study Jam and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You should be somewhat technical with Python and Command Shell! This workshop will also be limited to only 100 people in order to make it interactive with our instructor and the TAs.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
we will be learning:
--Image Processing--

*Cloud ML Engine: Qwik Start
*Cloud API Explorer: Qwik Start
*Classify Images of Clouds in the Cloud with AutoML Vision
*Detect Labels, Faces, and Landmarks in Images with the Cloud Vision API
*Extract, Analyze, and Translate Text from Images with the Cloud ML APIs
*Automate Cancer MCA using Cloud Vision API and GCMLE:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MANDATORY:

At the event, we’ll use a tool called Qwiklabs, a Google training product. If you’ve used Qwiklabs before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you haven’t, save time by creating a new Qwiklabs account for yourself prior to the class at: https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up (creating an account is free).

We’ll give you a link and token for free Qwiklabs access. Make sure you check the opt-in box for promos, especially because that makes you eligible for additional free access after you complete the first series of labs.

You’ll Receive:

Free access to Qwiklabs hands-on labs, a $55+ value
Earn Google Cloud badges to show your skills and expertise
No need to register with a credit card

What to bring to the event:
Laptop -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
Laptop charger
The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, use Firefox or Chrome.
Looking forward to seeing you at the event!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Prizes? Yes!!!!

There will be prizes for those that participate and complete the workshop with us. ^_^

Food? Yes!!!!

There will be food catering for the event.

We have

events.name: GDG Fremont DevFest 2020
events.description:
YOU MUST RSVP via EVENTBRITE for this event: https://bit.ly/37oejFi

NO ENTRY WITHOUT TICKET

GDG DevFest Fremont returns on March 1st at the 42 Silicon Valley. Join developers, students, mentors, and tech companies for the biggest community organized Google developer conference in the Bay Area. DevFest Fremont is a community-run, one-day conference aimed at bringing technology enthusiasts and experts together. About 300 people are estimated to attend DevFest, with speakers coming from all over Bay Area and the US. The talks will focus on Google technologies along with other emerging technologies such as Android, Flutter, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, the Mobile Web, Google Assistant, Machine Learning, and more.

DevFest attendees will be able to familiarize themselves with new and emerging technologies, network, socialize, and help to build the growing tech community in the Bay Area. Anyone interested in technology is welcome. Each ticket includes talks from industry experts, skill-building sessions, gifts, and lunch.

Our official site is up!!!!

https://GDGFremontDevFest2020.com

Schedule and more speakers coming soon.

Brought to you, with love, by GDG Fremont, GDG Cloud Fremont and GDG Cloud Silicon Valley!

Can't wait until then? checkout DevFest on demand:

https://devfest.withgoogle.com/ondemand

Checkout last year's DevFest:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hTJ_-MxHKMY

events.name: Firebase Virtual Meetup - GDG Fremont
events.description:
YOU MUST REGISTER AT:
https://events.withgoogle.com/firebase-virtual-meetup-gdg-fremont/#content

TO PARTICIPATE

### The Firebase team is excited to host a virtual meetup.

Firebase Virtual Meetup will bring together Firebasers and groups of developers in intimate online settings. Come join us and your fellow GDG Fremont members as we present on Firebase products. This is a great opportunity to ask hard questions in a small group setting, and provide product feedback.

Attendees should have prior knowledge and experience with Firebase products. In order to ensure more intimate engagement session will be capped at 25 attendees.

Join from PC, Mac, Linux, iOS or Android. Looking forward to seeing you at the event!

### Agenda

What's new in Firebase?
2019 was a busy year for the Firebase team with numerous feature and product launches. And now in 2020, despite the challenges faced by everybody, we are still hard at work to enhance your app development experience. In this talk we will look at several new features Firebase introduced in the recent past.

We will start with the Firebase Emulator suite, which enables developers to locally test their Firestore and Security Rules integrations. We will see how to write unit tests around your app's database interactions, so that you can systematically reason about the correctness and security of your code. We will also look at some new additions to the Firestore Security Rules language, and how they can be used to specify complex access and integrity constraints for your data.

Next we will look at Firebase Remote Config support for the web, and how you can build custom web experiences based on your user's browser, location and various other preferences. We will also get acquainted with Firebase Extensions, a series of pre-packaged solutions that you can add to your apps to extend their capabilities.

Speaker • Hiranya Jayathilaka

### FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Here’s what you should know. For any other questions, please contact [masked].

Who should attend the Firebase Virtual Meetup
The attendees should have prior knowledge with Firebase products.

Why is seating limited ?
In order for us to ensure more intimate engagement and be able to address product questions, sessions will be capped at 25 attendees.

How do I find out if I am confirmed to attend the Firebase Virtual Meetup?
Once you have registered, you can expect to receive an email from the Firebase team to confirm your attendance.

The meeting will be hosted via Google Hangouts. All the instructions to join the Hangouts meeting will be in the confirmation email.

What are system requirements?
Join from PC, Mac, Linux, iOS or Android.

If you are attending the virtual meeting from a laptop, make sure to bring your charger!
